name: Yellowstone National Park
description: Yellowstone National Park is a national park of the United States located in the northwest corner of the state of Wyoming, with small portions extending into Montana and Idaho. It was established by the 42nd U.S. Congress through the Yellowstone National Park Protection Act and signed into law by President Ulysses S. Grant on March 1, 1872. Yellowstone was the first national park in the US, and is also widely understood to be the first national park in the world. The park is known for its wildlife and its many geothermal features, especially the Old Faithful geyser, one of its most popular. While it represents many types of biomes, subalpine forest is the most abundant. It is part of the South Central Rockies forests ecoregion.

locations.name: Old Faithful
locations.description: One of the most famous geysers in the world, erupting water up to 56 meters. Eruptions occur approximately every 91 minutes.

locations.name: Grand Prismatic Spring
locations.description: The largest hot spring in the United States and the third largest in the world. Known for its vibrant colors created by thermophilic bacteria.

locations.name: Yellowstone Lake
locations.description: The largest high-altitude lake in North America, located at 2,357 meters above sea level.

locations.name: Norris Geyser Basin
locations.description: The hottest and most geothermally active area in the park, home to the world's tallest active geyser — Steamboat Geyser.

locations.name: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
locations.description: A majestic 32-kilometer-long canyon with the Lower Falls and Upper Falls, formed by volcanic activity.

locations.name: Mammoth Hot Springs
locations.description: A complex of hot springs on a hill of travertine terraces, known for its colorful formations.

locations.name: Yellowstone River
locations.description: The longest undammed river in the contiguous United States, flowing through the park and creating scenic views.

locations.name: Hayden Valley
locations.description: Famous for its wildlife sightings, including bison, elk, and bears, particularly during early morning and evening.

locations.name: Tower Fall
locations.description: A 41-meter waterfall located near the Tower-Roosevelt area of the park, surrounded by unique rock formations.

routes.name: Upper Geyser Basin Loop
routes.description: A popular walking trail passing by numerous geysers, including Old Faithful and Morning Glory Pool.

routes.name: Lone Star Geyser Trail
routes.description: An easy 6.4 km trail leading to the Lone Star Geyser, which erupts up to 15 meters high.

routes.name: Mount Washburn Trail
routes.description: A popular trail to the summit of Mount Washburn, offering panoramic views of the park.

routes.name: Yellowstone Lake Trail
routes.description: Scenic trail along Yellowstone Lake with views of the water and surrounding mountains.

routes.name: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone Trail
routes.description: Trail along the canyon with multiple viewpoints of Upper and Lower Falls.

tips: Visit early in the morning or late in the evening to avoid crowds.
Keep a safe distance from wildlife.
Dress in layers as the weather can change quickly.
Use sun protection and wear a hat.
Bring plenty of water and snacks for longer hikes.
Check trail conditions before heading out.
Use maps or GPS to navigate remote areas.
Take your trash with you — Leave No Trace principles.
